name: R&D Engineer Computational Geometry and Design Optimization
description:
We are looking for a research engineer/scientist in the field of Computational Geometry, Design Optimization, Algorithm Design, and Machine Learning. You will join a team of software developers, mechanical engineers, clinical experts, and fellow researchers, to create next-generation solutions for Spark and Digital Orthodontics in general.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

    • Investigate various aspects of the digital orthodontics workflow to identify areas for automation and optimization.
    • Develop advanced algorithms and methodologies for automatic processing, augmentation, integration, and prediction of photographic, volumetric, geometric and/or meta data.
    • Participate in an iterative concept prototyping pipeline to validate or disprove new ideas.
    • Design experiments, metrics, and acceptance criteria, for the validation of proposed solutions both in terms of technical capability and clinical significance.
    • Implement proposed solutions as high-fidelity proptotypes that can be readily handed-over to product development teams for commercialization.
    • Create technical reports to document the investigation, its findings, and proposed solutions.
    • Work with cross-functional teams regularly to communicate progress and potential risks.
    • Conduct technology and patent scans to be in-tuned with the state of the art.
    • Participate in patent filing activities.
  • Job Requirements

Job Requirements

REQUIREMENTS:

    • Master's degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or other Engineering disciplines in related fields.
    • Minimum 3 years of professional R&D experience in Computational Geometry, Design Optimization, Algorithm Design, and Machine Learning.
    • Demonstrated problem-solving skills; ability to distill complex or abstract requirements into actionable ideas.
    • Strong mathematics and algorithm design skills.
    • Good spoken and written English skills.
    • Effective technical writing skills.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

    • PhD in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or other Engineering disciplines in related fields.
    • Solid C++ and object-oriented programming skills; proficiency in design patterns and best practices; industry experience in commercial software development.
    • Deep understanding of 3D modeling techniques, triangular mesh processing, optimization algorithms, and numerical methods.
    • Knowledge and experience in various AI fields.
    • Strong communication skills; ability to explain complex ideas in ways that can resonate with and influence other people.
    • Proven ability to challenge the status quo and think outside the box; ability to learn from previous mistakes and iterate to generate new solutions quickly.
    • Experiences in data analysis and visualization is a plus.
    • Prior work experiences in healthcare (FDA) regulated industry is a plus.

Critical Success Factors:

    • Solid technical understanding and real-world experiences in related fields.
    • A growth mindset and a relentless pursuit of continuous improvement; willingness to constantly challenge oneself and be challenged; openness to different ideas and unfamiliar domains.

Results Oriented; a good understanding and appreciation of the balance between scientific rigor and engineering solutions.
